question: Match List-I (Reagents) with List-II (Structural prediction) for Glucose:
a. Acetic anhydride, b. Bromine water, c. Hydroiodic acid, d. Hydrogen cyanide
i. Glucose has an aldehyde group
ii. Glucose has a straight chain of six carbon atoms
iii. Glucose has five hydroxyl group
iv. Glucose has a carbonyl group
explanation: Bromine water oxidizes aldehyde -> Aldehyde group (b-i).
HI reduces to n-hexane -> Straight chain (c-ii).
